title: tmn at #SMM4H 2023: Comparing Text Preprocessing Techniques for Detecting Tweets Self-reporting a COVID-19 Diagnosis. (arXiv:2311.00732v1 [cs.CL])
abstract: The paper describes a system developed for Task 1 at SMM4H 2023. The goal of the task is to automatically distinguish tweets that self-report a COVID-19 diagnosis (for example, a positive test, clinical diagnosis, or hospitalization) from those that do not. We investigate the use of different techniques for preprocessing tweets using four transformer-based models. The ensemble of fine-tuned language models obtained an F1-score of 84.5%, which is 4.1% higher than the average value.

Title: tmn at #SMM4H 2023: Comparing Text Preprocessing Techniques for Detecting Tweets Self-reporting a COVID-19 Diagnosis. (arXiv:2311.00732v1 [cs.CL])
Abstract: The paper describes a system developed for Task 1 at SMM4H 2023. The goal of the task is to automatically distinguish tweets that self-report a COVID-19 diagnosis (for example, a positive test, clinical diagnosis, or hospitalization) from those that do not. We investigate the use of different techniques for preprocessing tweets using four transformer-based models. The ensemble of fine-tuned language models obtained an F1-score of 84.5%, which is 4.1% higher than the average value.
translated_title: tmn在#SMM4H 2023上的论文:比较用于检测自我报告COVID-19诊断推文的文本预处理技术
translated_abstract: 本文描述了一个用于SMM4H 2023任务1的系统。该任务的目标是自动区分那些自我报告COVID-19诊断的推文（例如，阳性检测、临床诊断或住院）和那些没有的推文。我们使用四个基于transformer的模型研究了不同的推文预处理技术。经过微调的语言模型集成获得了84.5%的F1得分，比平均值高出4.1%。
tldr: 本文研究了用于检测自我报告COVID-19诊断推文的不同文本预处理技术，通过使用四个基于transformer的模型进行实验，并通过微调语言模型集成获得了比平均值高出4.1%的84.5%的F1得分。
en_tdlr: This paper investigates different text preprocessing techniques for detecting tweets self-reporting a COVID-19 diagnosis. By using four transformer-based models and fine-tuning a language model ensemble, it achieved an F1-score of 84.5%, which is 4.1% higher than the average value.
